modules.description: This module defines and manipulates ALSA sequencer events, including MIDI-like messages such as note on/off, controller changes, and pitch bend. It works with event types like `note` and `controller`, which carry channel, parameter, and value fields. Concrete use cases include constructing and deconstructing MIDI events for music synthesis, handling real-time input from MIDI devices, and implementing custom MIDI processing logic.

This module enables low-level audio stream manipulation through operations like opening, configuring, and transferring PCM data with precise control over playback and capture. It operates on handles and parameter structures to manage audio formats, buffer sizes, and synchronization, while supporting both standard and Bigarray float arrays for efficient data handling. Designed for applications requiring direct ALSA interaction, it facilitates tasks such as real-time audio processing, low-latency streaming, and hardware-specific configuration.

Handles MIDI event routing and port management for ALSA sequencer clients. It creates and configures sequencer ports with specific capabilities and types, subscribes to input/output ports, and processes MIDI-like events such as note on/off, controller changes, and pitch bend. Used to build applications that interact directly with MIDI hardware or software, like synthesizers, MIDI controllers, or real-time music processors.

This module interfaces directly with ALSA sound drivers to control audio and MIDI devices at a low level. It provides functions for retrieving ALSA version information, handling errors, and suppressing error output to stderr, working with exceptions and a custom direction type. The module's submodules enable precise PCM audio stream manipulation and ALSA sequencer MIDI event handling, supporting concrete use cases such as real-time audio processing, low-latency playback/capture, and MIDI device control.
